segment.source: Monitor your Microsoft Surface Hub
segment.target: Monitor your Microsoft Surface Hub

segment.source: Monitoring for Microsoft Surface Hub devices is enabled through Microsoft Operations Management Suite (OMS).
segment.target: Monitoring for Microsoft Surface Hub devices is enabled through Microsoft Operations Management Suite (OMS).

segment.source: Monitor your Microsoft Surface Hub
segment.target: Monitor your Microsoft Surface Hub

segment.source: Monitoring for Microsoft Surface Hub devices is enabled through Microsoft Operations Management Suite (OMS).
segment.target: Monitoring for Microsoft Surface Hub devices is enabled through Microsoft Operations Management Suite (OMS).

segment.source: The Operations Management Suite (OMS) is Microsoft's IT management solution that helps you manage and protect your entire IT infrastructure, including your Surface Hubs.
segment.target: The Operations Management Suite (OMS) is Microsoft's IT management solution that helps you manage and protect your entire IT infrastructure, including your Surface Hubs.

segment.source: You can use OMS to help you track the health of your Surface Hubs as well as understand how they are being used.
segment.target: You can use OMS to help you track the health of your Surface Hubs as well as understand how they are being used.

segment.source: Log files are read on the devices and sent to the OMS service.
segment.target: Log files are read on the devices and sent to the OMS service.

segment.source: Issues like servers being offline, the calendar not syncing, or the device account being unable to log into Skype are shown in OMS in the Surface Hub dashboard.
segment.target: Issues like servers being offline, the calendar not syncing, or the device account being unable to log into Skype are shown in OMS in the Surface Hub dashboard.

segment.source: By using the data in the dashboard, you can identify devices that are not running, or that are having other problems, and potentially apply fixes for the detected issues.
segment.target: By using the data in the dashboard, you can identify devices that are not running, or that are having other problems, and potentially apply fixes for the detected issues.

segment.source: OMS requirements
segment.target: OMS requirements

segment.source: In order to manage your Surface Hubs from the Microsoft Operations Management Suite (OMS), you'll need the following:
segment.target: In order to manage your Surface Hubs from the Microsoft Operations Management Suite (OMS), you'll need the following:

segment.source: A valid subscription to OMS.
segment.target: A valid subscription to OMS.

segment.source: Subscription level in line with the number of devices.
segment.target: Subscription level in line with the number of devices.

segment.source: OMS pricing varies depending on how many devices are enrolled, and how much data it processes.
segment.target: OMS pricing varies depending on how many devices are enrolled, and how much data it processes.

segment.source: You'll want to take this into consideration when planning your Surface Hub rollout.
segment.target: You'll want to take this into consideration when planning your Surface Hub rollout.

segment.source: Next, you will either add an OMS subscription to your existing Microsoft Azure subscription or create a new workspace directly through the OMS portal.
segment.target: Next, you will either add an OMS subscription to your existing Microsoft Azure subscription or create a new workspace directly through the OMS portal.

segment.source: Detailed instructions for setting up the account can be found at: Onboard in minutes.
segment.target: Detailed instructions for setting up the account can be found at: Onboard in minutes.

segment.source: Once the OMS subscription is set up, there are two ways to enroll your Surface Hub devices:
segment.target: Once the OMS subscription is set up, there are two ways to enroll your Surface Hub devices:

segment.source: Automatically through InTune, or
segment.target: Automatically through InTune, or

segment.source: Manually through Settings.
segment.target: Manually through Settings.

segment.source: Setting up monitoring
segment.target: Setting up monitoring

segment.source: You can monitor health and activity of your Surface Hub using Microsoft Operations Management Suite (OMS).
segment.target: You can monitor health and activity of your Surface Hub using Microsoft Operations Management Suite (OMS).

segment.source: The device can be enrolled in OMS remotely, using InTune, or locally, by using Settings.
segment.target: The device can be enrolled in OMS remotely, using InTune, or locally, by using Settings.

segment.source: Enrolling devices through InTune
segment.target: Enrolling devices through InTune

segment.source: You'll need the workspace ID and primary key for your Surface Hub.
segment.target: You'll need the workspace ID and primary key for your Surface Hub.

segment.source: You can get those from the OMS portal.
segment.target: You can get those from the OMS portal.

segment.source: InTune is a Microsoft product that allows you to centrally manage the OMS configuration settings that will be applied to one or more of your devices.
segment.target: InTune is a Microsoft product that allows you to centrally manage the OMS configuration settings that will be applied to one or more of your devices.

segment.source: Follow these steps to configure your devices through InTune:
segment.target: Follow these steps to configure your devices through InTune:

segment.source: Sign in to InTune.
segment.target: Sign in to InTune.

segment.source: Navigate to SettingsConnected Sources.
segment.target: Navigate to SettingsConnected Sources.

segment.source: Create or edit a policy based on the Surface Hub template.
segment.target: Create or edit a policy based on the Surface Hub template.

segment.source: Navigate to the OMS section of the policy, and add the workspace ID and primary key to the policy.
segment.target: Navigate to the OMS section of the policy, and add the workspace ID and primary key to the policy.

segment.source: Save the policy.
segment.target: Save the policy.

segment.source: Associate the policy with the appropriate group of devices.
segment.target: Associate the policy with the appropriate group of devices.

segment.source: InTune will now sync the OMS settings with the devices in the target group, enrolling them in your OMS workspace.
segment.target: InTune will now sync the OMS settings with the devices in the target group, enrolling them in your OMS workspace.

segment.source: Enrolling devices using the Settings app
segment.target: Enrolling devices using the Settings app

segment.source: You'll need the workspace ID and primary key for your Surface Hub.
segment.target: You'll need the workspace ID and primary key for your Surface Hub.

segment.source: You can get those from the OMS portal.
segment.target: You can get those from the OMS portal.

segment.source: If you don't use InTune to manage your environment, you can enroll devices manually through Settings:
segment.target: If you don't use InTune to manage your environment, you can enroll devices manually through Settings:

segment.source: From your Surface Hub, start Settings.
segment.target: From your Surface Hub, start Settings.

segment.source: Enter the device admin credentials when prompted.
segment.target: Enter the device admin credentials when prompted.

segment.source: Click System, and navigate to Microsoft Operations Management Suite.
segment.target: Click System, and navigate to Microsoft Operations Management Suite.

segment.source: Click Configure.
segment.target: Click Configure.

segment.source: Select Enable monitoring.
segment.target: Select Enable monitoring.

segment.source: In the OMS settings dialog, type the workspace ID.
segment.target: In the OMS settings dialog, type the workspace ID.

segment.source: Repeat steps 5 and 6 for the primary key.
segment.target: Repeat steps 5 and 6 for the primary key.

segment.source: Click OK to complete the configuration.
segment.target: Click OK to complete the configuration.

segment.source: A confirmation dialog will appear telling you whether or not the OMS configuration was successfully applied to the device.
segment.target: A confirmation dialog will appear telling you whether or not the OMS configuration was successfully applied to the device.

segment.source: If it was, the device will start sending data to OMS.
segment.target: If it was, the device will start sending data to OMS.

segment.source: Monitoring devices
segment.target: Monitoring devices

segment.source: Monitoring your Surface Hubs using OMS is much like monitoring any other enrolled devices.
segment.target: Monitoring your Surface Hubs using OMS is much like monitoring any other enrolled devices.

segment.source: Sign in to the OMS portal.
segment.target: Sign in to the OMS portal.

segment.source: Navigate to the Surface Hub solution pack dashboard.
segment.target: Navigate to the Surface Hub solution pack dashboard.

segment.source: Your device's health will be displayed here.
segment.target: Your device's health will be displayed here.

segment.source: You can create OMS alerts based on existing or custom queries that use the data collected through OMS.
segment.target: You can create OMS alerts based on existing or custom queries that use the data collected through OMS.

segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: Manage Microsoft Surface Hub
